meals.name: Pan-Seared Chicken with Garlicky Spinach and Rice
steps: Rinse rice thoroughly and cook according to package instructions. For 100g rice, typically use 200ml water and simmer until water is absorbed.
Pat the chicken breast dry and season generously with salt and pepper.
Heat half of the olive oil in a non-stick pan over medium-high heat. Add the chicken breast and sear for 5-7 minutes per side, or until cooked through and golden brown.
Remove chicken from the pan and set aside to rest. Slice into strips or cubes.
Add the remaining olive oil to the same pan. Mince the garlic and add it to the pan, saut√©ing for about 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add the spinach to the pan. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the spinach has wilted completely, about 3-5 minutes.
Season the spinach with a pinch of salt and pepper.
Serve the cooked rice in a bowl, top with the garlicky spinach and sliced pan-seared chicken.
